Internet Remarks: On the ‘sunset side’ of Bowen Island you’ll find this pretty little compact home, perfect for first time Buyers. With many recent updates, both beautiful and practical, it is move-in ready. Located on a ¼+ acre, and in a private setting with the gentle sounds of Explosives Creek nearby, it’s easy to leave behind the hustle and bustle of the city. The brand new kitchen features “Hague Blue” cabinets with brass hardware, Caesarstone countertops, hand-crafted Maple shelving, and new SS appliances. The environmentally conscientious Buyer will be thrilled with the addition of brand new Solar Panels that are hooked into the power grid. In the event of a power outage the new propane generator kicks in automatically and powers the whole house. There’s plenty of room in the bright and spacious garage for all your sports gear, or a home gym. The flex room is a perfect quiet spot for your office if you work from home. Membership in the Tunstall Bay Beach Club (pool, tennis court, clubhouse, kayak racks) available.

Commission: 3.22% ON THE FIRST $100,000 PLUS 1.15% ON THE REMAINDER OF THE PURCHASE PRICE
Internet Remarks: If you have ever dreamed of having a rural lifestyle, and being a proud steward of the environment, this rare 6-acre sanctuary is for you. The deep, organic soil nurtures the ‘food forest’ gardens, and the solar panels can provide you with free off-grid power from about March to November. Multiple water sources provide ample supply for irrigation and drinking. The cozy 1+ bedroom cottage oozes charm from bygone days. Recent updates include new windows, insulation, electrical, plumbing, new kitchen, and metal roof. Approx. 1/3rd of the land has been cleared and is relatively flat, and the southern exposure ensures plenty of sunshine year round. The remainder of the property is forested, with private trails throughout, and surrounded by crown land on 3 sides with the 1000 acre Bowen Island Ecological Reserve beyond. Sunset here is magical as rays of light reach deep into the clearings in the forest, the frogs begin to sing, and the deer stop by to say hello. Special places like this don’t come along very often.

Public Remarks: This off-the-grid cottage was carefully integrated into a 100 foot stretch of marine shoreline, maintaining vegetation and maximizing wildlife use. Bald eagles roost immediately above the cottage and fish in the bay below that hosts a myriad of seabirds as well as dolphins, orcas, mink and otters. Access is available to a rocky shore below, where you can swim in the warm bay waters.
